meanings.definition: Seignories: the territories or lands of a seignior or lord
meanings.sent1: The seignories of the king stretched far and wide, encompassing many villages.
meanings.sent2: The seignories of the noble families were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended to rule over their backyard seignories.
meanings.sent4: In her imagination, the forest became a magical realm of seignories ruled by mystical creatures.
meanings.sent5: The map displayed the seignories as colorful patches of land, each with its own story.

meanings.definition: Seignories: the rights or privileges of a seignior or lord
meanings.sent1: The seignories granted the lord the power to collect taxes from the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The seignories included the exclusive right to hold grand feasts in the castle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous jester tried to claim the seignorial privilege of wearing the king's crown.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was her most treasured seignorial attribute, bringing joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll detailed the seignorial rights of the ruling class, outlining their authority.
